chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason D Lepak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 100 days granted, if imposed.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

No contact with any of the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint in this case and 22CM649.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

Take Thinking for a Change Course.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by Agent.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:48 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jason D Lepak in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is requesting a projected plea and sentencing in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:20 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Jason D Lepak in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Gutierrez presents arguments; he is asking that cash bail be lowered or changed to a signature bond.  State objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Motion to Modify Bail.  Court orders bail to remain as previously set.  Court inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he has an offer and parties are inclined to resolve but he is still waiting for discovery.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a further proceedings in about 30-45 days, but if matter can be converted to plea and sentencing he will advise the court immediately.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Court inquires about the preliminary hearing in this matter.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
